Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse, partially grey in section and contains a number of small white inclusions, the interior is covered with a yellow-brown wash, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394635) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394635)
